instruction: Help me check the keyboard shortcuts for merging visible layers and closing all files in GIMP.

traj.observation: The screenshot shows an Ubuntu Linux desktop with a purple and orange geometric jellyfish wallpaper. Three folder icons named "material", "Editing", and "soul" are aligned horizontally in the center of the screen. In the top-right corner, there is an image file named "soul.jpg". A vertical dock is visible on the left side containing application icons such as Chrome, Firefox, Visual Studio Code, VLC, LibreOffice applications, GIMP, Files, Settings, and the application launcher. The top bar displays Activities, the date and time, and system status icons.
traj.thought: I need to help the user check keyboard shortcuts for merging visible layers and closing all files in GIMP.
traj.action: Click on the GIMP application icon (the cartoon dog with a paintbrush) in the left sidebar dock to launch GIMP.

traj.observation: The GIMP (GNU Image Manipulation Program) application is open. The main menu bar contains File, Edit, Select, View, Image, Layer, Colors, Tools, Filters, Windows, and Help. The toolbox is visible on the left, and the canvas area in the center displays the default GIMP Wilber logo. Panels for brushes, layers, and tool options are visible on the right side.
traj.thought: GIMP has successfully launched and is ready for use.
traj.action: Click on the "Edit" menu in the top menu bar of the GIMP application.

traj.observation: The Edit menu in GIMP is open. The dropdown menu displays options such as Undo, Redo, Cut, Copy, Paste, Clear, Fill options, Preferences, Input Devices, and Keyboard Shortcuts. The Keyboard Shortcuts option is clearly visible.
traj.thought: The Edit menu contains the Keyboard Shortcuts option needed to proceed.
traj.action: Click on the "Keyboard Shortcuts" option in the Edit menu to view the keyboard shortcut settings in GIMP.

traj.observation: The Configure Keyboard Shortcuts dialog window is open. It contains a search bar at the top and a list of action categories such as File, Edit, Select, View, Image, Layers, Channels, Paths, Tools, Dialogs, Windows, and Plug-ins. Most shortcuts are marked as Disabled. Help, Save, and Close buttons are visible at the bottom of the dialog.
traj.thought: The keyboard shortcuts dialog allows viewing and configuring shortcuts.
traj.action: Click on the plus sign next to the "File" category to expand it and view file-related shortcuts.

traj.observation: The File category is expanded in the Configure Keyboard Shortcuts dialog. File-related actions such as Open, Export, Open as Layers, and Close All are visible. The Close All action shows the keyboard shortcut Ctrl + Q.
traj.thought: The Close All shortcut has been identified.
traj.action: Click on the minus sign next to the "File" category to collapse it.

traj.observation: The Configure Keyboard Shortcuts dialog displays multiple action categories in a collapsed state, including File, Edit, Select, View, Image, Layers, Channels, and Tools. Most shortcuts are currently disabled.
traj.thought: Next, the Layers category needs to be explored.
traj.action: Click on the plus sign next to "Layers" to expand the Layers category.

traj.observation: The Layers category is expanded in the Configure Keyboard Shortcuts dialog. Several layer-related actions are visible, including alpha channel and selection-related options. Most shortcuts in this category are disabled.
traj.thought: Scrolling is needed to find the Merge Visible Layers option.
traj.action: Scroll down in the Configure Keyboard Shortcuts dialog.

traj.observation: The dialog has been scrolled further within the Layers category. Additional layer-related actions such as Duplicate Layer and Flatten Image are visible.
traj.thought: Continue scrolling to locate Merge Visible Layers.
traj.action: Scroll down in the Configure Keyboard Shortcuts dialog.

traj.observation: Further scrolling reveals more Layers actions, including layer mask operations and layer locking options. All visible shortcuts in this section remain disabled.
traj.thought: The Merge Visible Layers shortcut should appear further down.
traj.action: Scroll down in the Configure Keyboard Shortcuts dialog.

traj.observation: The Merge Visible Layers action is visible under the Layers category. The keyboard shortcut for Merge Visible Layers is Ctrl + Shift + M. The New Layer action is also visible with the shortcut Shift + Ctrl + N.
traj.thought: Both required keyboard shortcuts have been identified successfully.
traj.action: Terminate the task with success status as the required keyboard shortcuts have been found.
